bibl.title: John Leonard v. State of Washington. Writ of Habeus Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: In the Circuit Court of the United States. Ninth Judicial Circuit, District of Washington, Eastern Northern Division.
In the Matter of the Application of John Leonard, for A Writ of Habeus Corpus.

To the Hon. C. H. Handford, Judge of the Circuit Court of the United States, Ninth judicial circuit, District of Washington Eas- ternn Northern Division The petition of John Leonard respectfully shows to your Honor; First-That the said petitioner is now a prisoner imprisoned and confined in the County Jail at Colfax, Whitman County, State of Wash- ington, in the custody of the Sheriff of Whitman County, State of Washington.

Sedond- That the cause or pretense of the restraint of the said petitioner according to the best of his knowledge and belief is, that on the 29th day of July, 1896, H.W Canfield as Prosecuting Attorney in and for the County of Whitman, State of Washington, made and filed with the Clerk of the Superior Court in and for Whitman County, an information charging the above named petitioner with the crime of Murder in the first degree, which said information is in writing in words and figures as follows, so-wit; ZState of Washington County of Whitman.

IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON FOR THE COUNTY OF WHITMAN. The State of Washington, Plaintiff, INFORMATION. vs John Leonard, Defendant. Comes now H.W. Canfield, prosecuting and County Attorney, for the County of Whitman, State of Washington, and by this information accuses John Leonard, of the crime of murder in the first degree, com- mitted as follows, to-wit: That the said John Leonard, in the County of Whitman, in the State of Washington, on the 18th day of July, eighteen hundred and
